intro: Conioselinum univittatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wormwood, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the Asteraceae family. It is native to regions of Europe and Asia and is often found in dry, grassy habitats. Conioselinum univittatum is typically perennial and has a compact growth habit.
